diseases.name: Type-2 Diabetes
diseases.description: A chronic condition where the body becomes resistant to insulin or doesn't produce enough insulin to maintain normal glucose levels.

diseases.name: Coronary Artery Disease
diseases.description: A condition where plaque builds up in coronary arteries, reducing blood flow to the heart muscle.

diseases.name: Hypertension
diseases.description: Persistently elevated blood pressure that increases risk of heart disease, stroke, and kidney problems.

diseases.name: Familial Hypercholesterolemia
diseases.description: An inherited disorder causing very high cholesterol levels from birth, significantly increasing heart disease risk.

diseases.name: Breast/Ovarian Cancer Risk
diseases.description: Inherited genetic mutations (especially BRCA1/BRCA2) that significantly increase lifetime risk of breast and ovarian cancers.

diseases.name: Thalassemia Carrier Risk
diseases.description: An inherited blood disorder causing reduced hemoglobin production, leading to anemia and fatigue.

diseases.name: Sickle Cell Disease Risk
diseases.description: An inherited disorder causing red blood cells to become rigid and sickle-shaped, leading to pain and organ damage.

diseases.name: Asthma Predisposition
diseases.description: A chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and breathing difficulties triggered by various factors.

diseases.name: Hypothyroidism Predisposition
diseases.description: A condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone, slowing metabolism.

diseases.name: PCOS Predisposition
diseases.description: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome - a hormonal disorder causing irregular periods, excess androgens, and metabolic issues.
